meanings.definition: A roof having two slopes on all sides with the lower slope steeper than the upper one.
meanings.sent1: The old house had unique mansards that made it stand out in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The historic building's mansards added charm to its overall appearance.
meanings.sent3: During the storm, the mansards protected the attic from heavy rain, creating a cozy space.
meanings.sent4: The mansards of the castle reached towards the sky like giant wings.
meanings.sent5: The mansards of the barn were painted a cheerful red, brightening up the farmyard.

meanings.definition: A style of roof with two slopes on all sides, the lower slope being steeper than the upper one.
meanings.sent1: The architect designed the new building with elegant mansards to give it a classic look.
meanings.sent2: In the city, many buildings feature mansards as part of their architectural design.
meanings.sent3: The mansards of the house looked like a pair of welcoming arms embracing the structure.
meanings.sent4: The mansards of the church seemed to reach towards the heavens, pointing to the divine above.
meanings.sent5: The mansards of the school were a distinctive feature that students admired every day.
